ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learning about different biological reactors and biological processes for treating water.
Bioreactor process conceptual knowledge and calculations.
I've learned a lot about developing the processes necessary in water treatment, and more generally, how to apply physical concepts to the design of bioreactors relevant to my work.
Understanding of microbial kinetics, familiarity with many current bioprocess research topics

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Good pace for presenting material. Good amount of material for semester.
Good course for the biological processes in environmental engineering, but was mostly focused on bioreactors and could have used more time on other topics as well.

I think the strengths were the lectures, which were thorough and very directly explained what was necessary for projects and homework. However, perhaps the homeworks could have been a bit more theoretical (mass balance and control volume design wise).

strengths: engaging presentations, breadth of topics covered, instructor availability weakness: course might benefit from more visual examples (e.g. what does a lab scale bioreactor look like) - the videos presented were very helpful for understanding

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If they are interested in the biological side of environmental engineering
Yes it was a good course but may be challenging if one has a weak physics/mathematics/engineering background.
I would highly recommend this course to any environmental engineer. Biological processes are the foundation of the field in a way.
